div.l: Lo here our͗e siluer redy for to spende
The myller to the toun his douter sende
For ale and bred and rosted them a Goos
And bonde her hors it shuld nomore go loos
And in his owen cham̄bre he made a bedde
With shetis and wᵗith chalons faire yspredde
Nat fro his owen bedde x feet or xii
His douter had a bedde all by hir self
Right in the same Chambre by and by
It myght no better and cause why
Ther͗e was no roumer heb heb herbergh in þat place
They suppen̄ and speken hem to solace
And drynken eủere strong ale at the beste
Aboute mydnyght wente they to reste
Weel hath this myller vernysshed his hede
For pale he was for dronken and nat rede
He yexeth and he speketh thurgh þe nose
As he were in the the quakke or in the pose
To bedde he goth and with hym goth his wyfe
As any Iay he was light and Iolyffe
So was hir ioly whistel weel I wette
The credel at hir beddes feet is y sette
To rokken and to gef the childe to souke
And whan þat dronken was all in the crouke
To bedde wente þe douter right a none
To bedde goth Aleyn and also Iohn
Ther͗e was no more them neded no dwale
This myller hath so wysely bybbed good ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his tayl be hynde he toke no kepe
His wyf bare hym a burdoıı̄un a full strong
Men myght here her rowtyng wel a furlong
The wenche routeth eke pur companye
Aleyn the Clerk þat herd þis melodye
He powked Iohn and seid slepest thow
Herdest thow eủere slike a song ar thanne now
Lo suche a cowplyng is be twyn them alle
A wylde fier on ther bodies falle
Who herkened eủere suche a ferly thyng
Ya they shal haue the flour of euel endyng
This lang nyght thar͗e tydes me no no reste
But yet no force all shal be for the beste
For Iohn seid he as eủere mote I thryve
Yf þat I may yon wenche wole I swyve
Som esement hath lawe shapen̄ vs
For Iohn th̉ere is a lawe that seith thus
That if a man in one poynte be agreued
That in an other he shal be releued
Our͗e corne is stole sothely it is no nay
And we haue had an euel fytte this day
And sith I shal haue non amendement
A gayn my lose I wole haue easement
By goddes saule it shal non other be
This Iohn answered Aleyn avise the
The miller is a ꝑpereloꝰus man he saide
And if þat he out of hise slepe a brayde
He myght done vs bothe a vilanye
Aleyn answered I counte nat by hym a flye
And vp he ryste and to þe wenche he creped
This wenche lay vp right and faste sleped
Til he so nygh was or she myght aspye
That it had ben to late for to crye
And shortely for to seyn they wer͗e at one
Now pley Aleyn̄ for I wole speke of Iohn
This Iohn lyeth stylle a furlong while or twoo
And to hym self he maketh ruthe and woo
Allas qᵈuod he this is a wykked iape
Now may I seyn I am but an ape
Yet hath my felow somwhat for his harme
He hath the myllers douter in his arme
He auentᵘureth hym and hath his nedys spedde
And I ly as a draf sak in my bedde
And when this Iape is told an other daye
I shal be holde a daf and a Cokenay
I wole a ryse and auentᵘure it by my feith
Vn hardy is vn sely thus men seith
And vp he rose and softely he wente
Vn to þe cradel and in his hond it hente
And bar it softe vn to his beddes feete
Sone after the wyfe hir roughtyng lete
And gan to wake and wente hir out to pisse
And come a gayn and gan hir cradel mysse
And groped her͗e and ther͗e but she fonde none
Allas qduod she I had al most mysgone
I had all most gon̄ to the clerkes bedde
Ey benedicite þan had I foule spedde
And forth she goth til she the cradel fonde
She gropeth al wey ferther with hir honde
